chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly Denise Kirkland-Flatt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kelly Denise Kirkland-Flatt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kelly Denise Kirkland-Flatt was found guilty of Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:41 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Kelly Denise Kirkland-Flatt in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Kelly Denise Kirkland-Flatt.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CM649, 22CF0342, 22CF466, 22CM82, & 22CM373.  ADA Rockow recites joint agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads G to AMENDED 943.23(3m) Ct 1- Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent Abandon Vehicle in 22CF342 and G to Ct 1- Disorderly Conduct 21CM649. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in21CM649 & AMENDED Ct 1 in 22CF342.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF342 and out right dismisses 22CF466, 22CM82, & 22CM373.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 21CM649

I/S 30 days county jail consecutive to count 1 in 22CF342
2 Years Probation Concurrent to count 1 in 22CF342

- Court Costs: $243.00  
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
 Balance to be pd through probation

Court Orders: AMENDED Ct 1 in 22CF342

I/S 60 days county jail consecutive to count 1 in 21CM649
2 Years Probation Concurrent to count 1 in 21CM649

- Court Costs: $243.00  
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
- Restitution: $575, to be paid in increments not less than $50 per month, commencing 11/1/22. 
 Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- AODA and follow through 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Absolute sobriety, testing at agents discretion
- No Contact with Julie S or Kim M. 
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by today, 9/13/22

Court reserves on credit until 9/16/22

Adjourned at 10:15 AM. bph

3:28 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Kelly Denise Kirkland-Flatt. Defendant Kelly Denise Kirkland-Flatt in court. INCLUDES 21CM649, 22CF342, 22CF466, 22CM82 and 22CM373. Court reviews file and notes letter from Atty. Davis on file that there is a global offer to all pending cases. Atty. Davis states there is a global resolution and he has updated contact information for DE. 22CF342 and 22CF466 (WOPH): Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets PLEAS. DE updates address and phone number, Court orders DE's address and phone number to be sealed. Adjourned: 3:41 PM. kma

Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kim M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
